meanings.definition: The movement of an organism in response to temperature changes.
meanings.sent1: The thermotaxes of the lizard helped it find a warm spot to bask in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Salmon use thermotaxes to swim upstream to spawn in cooler waters.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's thermotaxes led it straight to the ice cream stand!
meanings.sent4: The thermotaxes of the bee guided it to the flower like a heat-seeking missile.
meanings.sent5: The thermotaxes of the cat made it curl up next to the cozy fireplace.

meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to detect and move towards or away from temperature gradients.
meanings.sent1: The bird's thermotaxes allowed it to find the warmest spot in the nest.
meanings.sent2: Moths use thermotaxes to navigate towards sources of heat like light bulbs.
meanings.sent3: The thermotaxes of the dog made it chase after the sunbeam moving across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The thermotaxes of the plant caused it to lean towards the sunlight for optimal growth.
meanings.sent5: The thermotaxes of the snake helped it find a sunny rock to bask on.
